profile:
Imagine your home totally organized! At Closets by Design, we work to simplify your life by designing, building, and installing custom closets, garage cabinets, home offices, laundries, pantries, and much more. With a wide selection of finishes, accessories, and hardware, you will get the customized look you have always dreamed of and you can rely on our three decades of experience for total customer satisfaction. From our no obligation in-home consultation, custom tailored designs, and high quality product construction, we offer excellent value. For service in Toronto and Durham including Toronto Downtown, North York, Scarborough, Pickering, Ajax, Whitby, Oshawa, Uxbridge, Newcastle, Peterborough, and Bowmanville visit our website to book your free consultation today or visit our showroom in Toronto located at 667 Mount Pleasant Rd. or Scarborough 780 Birchmount Rd, Unit 8.    
Closets by Design: Quality, beauty, and commitment are built in!

profile:
At Garage Tailors we challenge the status quo in the home organization space, so that we can do our part to help make our clients day a little less stressful.  Our operating principles are trust, honesty, transparency and value.  The experience for our clients must be positive and one that they have to tell their friends about. 
Our philosophy is that every families garage transformation, whether it's solely a floor coating to a full renovation, be designed and constructed to be within an agreed upon budget and schedule, that is how we work with you. From the initial estimate to when we say thank you for your business, we believe that we can meet all your expectations.
We service the GTA and all the surrounding areas.

profile:
ClutterBGone is a full service company specializing in residential/home office organizing, de-cluttering, downsizing & life transition services, also providing packing and unpacking/settling in.  All services provided throughout the Greater Toronto Area.  fully insured and ClutterBGone is an active member of the Professional Organizers in Canada and the National Association of Professional Organizers.

Your Chaos. Our Solution. Your Peace of Mind.

At ClutterBGone we create positive, strong and lasting relationships. We’re honoured that our clients invite us to come into their homes and small businesses. That’s a huge leap of faith and we appreciate that trust.  We’ve worked hard to find and create solid partnerships with service providers in our industry that we can refer to and use for our clients with the utmost respect and integrity. Our clients are truly our # 1 priority.

profile:
Everyone’s needs and circumstances for downsizing, Estate Clearing and Moving are different; Alivio Solution understands that the process can be overwhelming, requiring patience and flexibility. We seek to take on the administrative burden of transitioning your home, or that of a loved one, from lived-in to sale or rent-ready so that you can focus on other aspects of your life transition. Alleviating your stress while saving you time, we look after all the details from decluttering to packing, moving, resettling, and more. Servicing Toronto and surrounding areas clients find peace of mind with Alivio.

Services include:

--> Downsizing | Decluttering | Estate Clearing
  - Auction set up
  - Donation
  - Disposal
  - Cleaning
  - Inheritance Distribution
--> Full Move Management | Packing | Downsize Moving | Unpacking | New Home Set Up
--> Staging
And more!

profile:
Carolyn Caldwell – Certified Professional Organizer
Experience
Carolyn Caldwell has over 11 years experience as a professional organizer.  She is a Gold Leaf member of Professional Organizers in Canada (POC).  She established her professional organizing business, Altered Organization, following twenty years working in the healthcare industry.

Awards
In 2015 she was honoured to be recognized by her peers as a finalist for both POC’s Harold Taylor and Ambassador Awards and recipient of the revered Harold Taylor Award.

 Education
Carolyn is committed to continuing education and credentialing. She was Canada’s first professional organizer to achieve both the Certified Professional Organizer in Chronic Disorganization (Institute for Challenging Disorganization, ICD) and Certified Professional Organizer (Board of Certified Professional Organizers) designations.

Carolyn has attained ICD Specialist Certificates in four areas:

Chronic Disorganization
Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD)
Aging
Hoarding
Most recently, she is training as a life coach to support her work with clients and students.  Carolyn’s main interest as a professional organizer is working with clients with Chronic Disorganization including ADD/ADHD.

She offers a mentoring program to individuals entering the professional organizing industry.

Author
In addition to writing on both the Altered Organization and Caldwell Evolution blogs, Carolyn is the author of the soon to be published book The Clutter Letters.

Volunteer
Carolyn has served on the POC National Board of Directors and is a Past Chair of the Toronto Chapter of POC. She has also served as its Program Coordinator. During the summer, Carolyn applies her organizing skills to support youth sailing. For the past 5 years, she has organized a novice race course for children age 15 and under learning to race in the Optimist Dinghy.

The Rest of the Story
During the winter, Carolyn teaches skiing and is certified as a ski instructor and coach.  She claims to be best at teaching terrified woman and crying children to enjoy the sport of downhill skiing. She is a mother of two active children.
memberships: Professional Organizers in Canada, National Association of Productivity and Organizing Professionals
name: Altered Organization

profile: ECO PROTECH is a company that operates in the field of air pollution treatment systems. The company handles all steps from planning the production, installation on site to maintenance. Today, very strict regulations apply to industrial and commercial work involving dust pollution in the air. Most activities that release air pollutants must observe emission limits, building and equipment regulations, as well as internal company operational stipulations, in order to properly protect staff and the environment.
